content.transcript:
Food pests are a source of food poisoning organisms and are a major hazard to food safety. They are detrimental to our health, hygiene and to the wellbeing of people.

Pests are responsible for spreading a number of diseases, spoiling food and damaging property.

To avoid all these damages, effective pest control methods should be implemented.

You need to control food pests in order to:

• prevent spread of disease like Weil's disease caused by rats;
• reduce the risk of food poisoning;
• prevent the contamination and wastage of food from bodies, fur, feathers, droppings and urine;
• reduce customer complaints;
• avoid losing staff who will not wish to work in infested premises;
• prevent damage like fires, which are caused by gnawing electric cables or flooding caused by gnawing of pipes by rats and mice;
• prevent loss of custom and profit, caused by selling contaminated food or by the discomfort or fear of customers using public areas of a food premises which are infested with mice, cockroaches or wasps; and finally
• to comply with the law and avoid being fined or closed.

page.statement: Food pests are a source of food poisoning organisms and a major hazard.
